channel.title: Hard travelin'
channel.description:
A series about Woody Guthrie and his Depression-era folk music.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Sacco-Vanzetti days
item.description: Woody helped immortalize the infamous Sacco-Vanzetti case in the songs featured here.
item.dc:creator: Adams, Judith
item.dc:subject: U.S. History (1900-present)

item.title: Union days, part two
item.description: In this program, the second of two parts, we continue our look at Woody's participation in the organizing of the unions.
item.dc:creator: Adams, Judith
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: The Dust Bowl revisited
item.description: Woody Guthrie speaks about the reactions of his friends to what they thought was the end of the world, and sings about their indomitable spirit.
item.dc:creator: Adams, Judith
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Woody's children, part one
item.description: This program, the first of two parts, explores Woody Guthrie's influence on the current crop of topical songwriters is shown, as demonstrated in this sampling of their music.
item.dc:creator: Adams, Judith
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Riding in my car
item.description: Pete Seeger has said that a song, like a child, can go out into the world and surprise its parents. We look at Woody's song "Car, Car" which must certainly have surprised its parent many times.
item.dc:creator: Adams, Judith
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Woody's children, part two
item.description: This program, the second of two parts, explores Woody Guthrie's influence on the current crop of topical songwriters is shown, as demonstrated in this sampling of their music.
item.dc:creator: Adams, Judith
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Travelling the land
item.description: Pete Seeger and Will Geer tell of Woody's travels and the songs that resulted.
item.dc:creator: Adams, Judith
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Travels end
item.description: Malvina Reynolds, Pete Seeger, and Will Geer recall Woody: His life, music, and hard travelin'.
item.dc:creator: Adams, Judith
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: The joys of childhood
item.description: Despite the misery of his own younger days, Woody never lost touch with the joys of childhood. A sample of the many children's songs he wrote.
item.dc:creator: Adams, Judith
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: The man behind the legend
item.description: This program focuses on Guthrie's childhood and how he came to hit the road.
item.dc:creator: Adams, Judith
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Bad men of the Depression
item.description: The gangster era caught the attention of the nation, and provided a likely source for Woody's writing. A sample of his badmen songs.
item.dc:creator: Adams, Judith
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Union days, part one
item.description: In this program, the first of two parts, Will Geer talks about Woody's introduction to New York, and how he took sides with the unions through song.
item.dc:creator: Adams, Judith
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Dust Bowl refugees
item.description: The great dust storms of the Midwest blew some of the victims all the way to California. Woody called them refugees; we find out why.
item.dc:creator: Adams, Judith
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts
